page.title: 18ROSTHERNE VILLAGE
page.content: NOTED IN THE DOMESDAY BOOK AS RODESTORNE (POSSIBLY OLD NORSE FOR RAUOD'S THORN),THE NAME HAS BEEN SPELT MANY WAYS SINCE. THIS{QUIET,ATTRACTIVE ESTATE VILLAGE WITH COBBLE STONE VERGES AND IVY COVERED COTTAGES HAS A HISTORY CLOSELY CONNECTED WITH THE EGERTONS AND TATTON PARK WHEN MOST OF THE VILLAGERS WORKED ON THE ESTATE.THIS HAS NOW PASSED INTO PRIVATE HANDS AND IS ADMINISTERED FROM MELLER BRAGGINS ESTATE OFFICE IN THE VILLAGE, WITH DUNHAM,TOFT, PEOVER AND MERE ESTATES. MR TOM WALL IS WARDEN OF{THE ROSTHERNE {MERE NATURE RESERVE RUN BY THE NATURE {CONSERVANCY COUNCIL.}THERE IS A HIDE CLOSE TO THE CHURCH FOR BIRD WATCHING WITH PERMITS AVAILABLE, MANCHESTER ORNITHOLOGICAL SOCIETY SELLS THESE. AS MANY AS 180 SPECIES HAVE BEEN RECORDED.
